group_1.narration: BiBi Online Valentine's Day Special!
Here in the booming city of Kamihama...
Every year, as Valentine's Day approaches, @women across the city engage in a heated showdown.
The Acorn-Walnut Wars!
It's a debate over the best kind of chocolate - @the Confectionery Village Acorns, @or the Chocolate Forest Walnuts? @They're both sweet treats @from Kamihama’s Hamururu Patisserie chain.
These two products - equally priced, and beloved by women @everywhere in the city each have their die-hard fans!
Would you say you’re on Team Acorn, or Team Walnut?

group_1.textCenter: Seriously, though, is there anyone who actually likes @acorns?
You can't make a big fuss about "sides" and "wars" @if one faction doesn't even exist!
But why does this argument erupt every @Valentine's Day?
To get answers, we went straight to Hamururu's @general manager!

group_1.textLeft: Since they're both affordable treats,
they've been very popular gifts for friends @for as long as I can remember.
It got to the point where, every Valentine's Day, @we had many eager customers,
and from there, people began to wonder which @makes the better gift: the acorn chocolate, @or the walnut?
Next thing you know, it became an all-out battle...

group_1.narration: The acorn and walnut treats @are both very important products to Hamururu!
The controversy had descended into such negativity @among our fans, and we wanted to change that!
So we began an official fan poll, The Acorn-Walnut Wars!

group_1.textLeft: Every year, we host this poll in each of the nine @wards in Kamihama.
We tally the count in each ward,
and the one that wins at least five of them...
...is recognized as the winner.
Thanks to our devoted fans, this event has gotten @more and more exciting each year.
Even Hamururu’s staff join in on the fun, by splitting @into each faction...
and competing with each other to promote @their team.

group_1.narration: ―Reporter―@Team Acorn has chosen their representative@for this year:
―Reporter―@Yachiyo Nanami,@a well-known model for the BiBi magazine!
―Reporter―@She's a Kamihama native, and has been a devoted acorn fan @ever since she was a little girl.
―Reporter― @I was told that when Team Acorn reached out to her, @she accepted their offer with a resounding “Yes!”

group_1.textLeft: My mother and my grandmother...
...both loved the Confectionery Village Acorn@chocolate.
Naturally, I do as well.

group_1.textRight: And that brings us to why BiBi is documenting the @event this year.
Our very own Yachiyo Nanami, a staple of our @magazine,
was chosen to represent Team Acorn!

group_1.textCenter: Now we’re at Team Walnut’s HQ.
They appear to be struggling to choose @their representative.

group_1.textRight: We’re screwed.
How can we possibly compete against @Yachiyo Nanami?

group_1.textLeft: Even if we contact someone in Kamihama who's just @as famous as her,
it'll be tough to get them to join up on such short @notice.

group_1.textRight: And before any of that, would they even accept @an offer from some puny local chain?

group_1.textLeft: Hmm... Our only chance is to make a splash along @totally different lines.

group_1.narration: Why not consider a unique local idol?

group_1.textLeft: Yeah, like one of the city’s singers or performers.

group_1.textRight: We actually had one person who immediately @sprung to mind early on?
Our local sword idol, Sayuki Fumino, but...

group_1.textCenter: I've been a huge acorn fan since before I was born, @soooo...!

group_1.textRight: ...she cut us down immediately.

group_1.textLeft: Sorry, I know this is an interview for BiBi,
but we’re just not very good at making this fun and @exciting...

group_1.textRight: Hey, no problem! It's cool to see what's going on @behind the scenes.
Speaking of which, Team Acorn actually had...
...two BiBi models in consideration for their rep.

group_1.textLeft: Oh, really? I didn't realize there was anyone as @beautiful as Yachiyo Nanami...

group_1.textRight: The other model has only occasionally @been featured in our magazine,
so to the general public, she's practically unknown.
She's only just begun her career, so she's a @complete newcomer!

group_1.textLeft: Hmm... So she's not as famous as Yachiyo Nanami...

group_1.textRight: Hang on - I think we could work that to our @advantage.

group_1.textLeft: Oh?

group_1.narration: Like... "It's a BiBi model showdown! @Team Walnut selects an up-and-coming rookie!"

group_1.textRight: You know, something like that.

group_1.textLeft: I see! It’d be egging on BiBi to cover our team as well.

group_1.textRight: They’d probably jump at the opportunity @to promote a special feature like this.
I feel like calling her "an up-and-coming rookie" @would be okay, right?
Well, I suppose it would be.

group_1.textLeft: ...Alright, let's go for it!

group_1.textRight: Wait...@you're actually doing it?
What a shocking development! @Not even I could’ve seen this coming!

group_1.narration: And with that...
This year's Acorn-Walnut Wars took on a surprise twist@and became a battle of the BiBi models!
Team Walnut has chosen their representative @to face off against Yachiyo Nanami...
Ria Ami!
